sense.name: (chemistry) a process in which one or more substances are changed into others.
sense.examples: There was a chemical reaction of the lime with the water. The reaction caused an explosion.

sense.name: An intellectual or emotional response to a stimulus.
sense.commentary: REACTION[+mental][+event] Note: may include additional physical responses, but must include an element of judgement.
sense.examples: His reaction to the news was to make a plan. He was please by the audience's reaction. John feared his mother's reaction to the broken lamp.

sense.name: A bodily process occurring due to the effect of some antecedent stimulus or agent.
sense.examples: He had a bad reaction to the medicine. His reactions have slowed with age.

sense.name: (mechanics) the equal and opposite force that is produced when any force is applied to a body.
sense.examples: Every action has an equal and opposite reaction.

sense.name: Something done in opposition to something else (policially or socially).
sense.examples: His style of painting was a reaction against cubism. The forces of reaction carried the election.
